intro: Everardia maguireana, commonly known as the Maguire's everardia, is a flowering plant species native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and compound leaves with opposite arrangement. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
